result.execSummary:
The defendant Javion Deshon Binion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
No possession of any firearms unless as part of the firearm safety course.
No new law arising to probable cause.
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javion Deshon Binion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javion Deshon Binion in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Javion Deshon Binion.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case passed to allow attorney to speak to defendant and recalled at 2:29 p.m. appearances remain the same.

Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statement made by EM.
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Firearm safety course
- no possession of any firearms unless as part of the firearm safety course
- no new law arising to probable cause

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Javion Deshon Binion in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javion Deshon Binion appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense requests resolution date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Javion Deshon Binion in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javion Deshon Binion appeared by video means with Attorney. Based on defendant's appearance in court via Zoom, Court orders stayed bench warrant cancelled.   Defense counsel has not received an offer and requests another status conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM.  Case in court for status conference. 
No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 37.  Calendar call scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Javion Deshon Binion in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered defendant to appear at the SPD office after today's hearing to see if he qualifies for representation.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Javion Deshon Binion in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javion Deshon Binion appeared by video means.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant failed to inform the SPD office of this court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javion Deshon Binion in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/22 @ 1:30p
